recipe.title: Vegan Wellington
recipe.ingredients: 1 sheet vegan puff pastry 2 tbsp ground flax meal + 5 tbsp water 2 tbsp cooking oil ½ medium onion, diced 2 small carrots, diced small 2 stalks celery, diced 4 cloves garlic, minced or crushed 1 tsp dried thyme 1 tsp ground sage ½ tsp dried rosemary 230g mushrooms, finely chopped 1.5 tbsp tamari sauce (sub soy sauce) 400g can of chickpeas, drained but not rinsed ¾ cup unsalted walnuts, ground into course meal ½ cup panko breadcrumbs 2 tbsp tomato paste 1½ tbsp vegan worcester sauce ½ tsp salt, more to taste Fresh cracked pepper, to taste 1 tbsp vegan butter, melted

method.step: Combine the ground flax and water in a small bowl. Set aside for 10 min. It will thicken and gel up
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion, celery and carrots. Saute until soft ~6-8 min
Add garlic, thyme, sage and rosemary. Saute for 1 min
Add mushrooms and saute until they soften and release moisture ~5-7 min. Add tamari and cook for 1 min. Remove from heat and set aside to cool for 10 min
Add chickpeas to mixing bowl and mash enough to break down whole chickpeas, but leave texture

Add cooled mixture, chickpeas, breadcrumbs, walnut meal, flax mixture, worcester sauce, tomato paste, salt and pepper. Combine well, use hands if needed. Add seasonings to taste. (If mixture seems too wet, add another ¼ cup of breadcrumbs or rolled oats)
Preheat oven to 200oC. Line rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside
Using your hands, shape mixture into a solid log that will fit into the middle of the pastry sheet (with a few inches of slack). Make sure log is packed well.

Unroll puff pastry sheet and lay it over the baking tray. Place the loaf in the middle of the pastry sheet. Pick up one side and wrap it over the loaf and repeat on the other side. Gently press to seal together (don’t force if it doesn’t close, just thin and lengthen the loaf or remove some mixture and form again) *if pastry doesn’t seal easily, lightly brush a little non-dairy milk in that area and seal

Roll up the ends and press gently to seal. Trim dough first before sealing if there is too much excess dough, otherwise the ends will be very doughy. Flip the loaf over so the sealed edges are facing the baking sheet

Brush the top and side with melted vegan butter. Using a sharp knife, gently make diagonal slits across the whole top of the loaf about 1 inch apart. Now repeat in the opposite direction to create criss cross slits

Place in the oven and bake for 30-35 min until heated throughout and the pastry is golden brown. Let sit for 10 min before gently cutting with sharp knife (it may be easier to cut along slits that were made earlier). Serve with gravy if desired!
